ServiceDescription.ServicePurposeText: This service takes a holistic look at the information sharing requirement and needs for release and re-entry from the perspective of corrections, other justice partners and community based service providers. The release and re-entry processes vary according to the respective business operations, processes and policies observed by the participating stakeholders including corrections, law enforcement, courts and community service providers.
ServiceDescription.ServiceScopeDescriptionText: The IJIS Institute invited key practitioners from corrections, law enforcement, courts and national leaders in corrections and re-entry community of interest to help articulate the requirements for information sharing. This group helped develop an overall Corrections Process Narrative (available as a separate document), and identified a number of exchanges that are critical for effective information sharing leading to an effective re-entry experience for an individual. These exchanges were then further refined/prioritized to identify the top 10 exchanges that needed to be addressed as a group. These exchanges are detailed in the Corrections SDD document
ServiceDescription.ServiceDescriptionSummaryText: The service provides access to and updates for a correction's subject case file for the purposes of supporting reentry

ServiceRealWorldEffects.RealWorldEffectDescriptionText: Service for Risk Assessment information so that the community based service providers better understand the risks associated with an individual.
Service to obtain Criminal History information.
Service for Share Notifications about the individual with a broad array of stakeholders based as the individual proceeds through the corrections process.
Service for Housing Information so that the individual is housed appropriately based on their specific housing needs and risk profiles
Service for Medicaid Entitlements so that the individual has appropriate coverage, and help minimize costs for the correctional facilities.
Service for Treatment Status to be shared between the community based service providers and the supervisory authorities.
Service for Inquiries about an individual to obtain demographic, release and risk information.
Service for Treatment Information about the individual with community based providers so they are able to provide adequate treatment while the individual is released.
Service for accessing information about a corrections subject with respect to release.
